Package org.wmn4j.analysis.harmony

Class KSKeyAnalysis

java.lang.Object
org.wmn4j.analysis.harmony.KSKeyAnalysis
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyAnalysis
public final class KSKeyAnalysis extends Object implements KeyAnalysis
Provides key analysis using the Krumhansl-Schmuckler key finding algorithm.

The Krumhansl and Schmuckler key finding algorithm [1] works by forming a chromagram (see Chromagram) of the given input and comparing that chromagram against predefined chromagrams for each major and minor key. The key whose chromagram has the greatest correlation with the chromagram of the input is returned. The predefined chromagrams are based on music psychology research.

This implementation of the algorithm uses duration weighing, i.e. the amount a note adds to a pitch class is directly proportional to its duration, when building the chromagram for the input.

[1] Krumhansl, C. L. (1990). Cognitive foundations of musical pitch. New York: Oxford University Press.

This class is immutable.
